results.title: The Biden-Trump Rerun: A Nation Craving Change Gets More of the Same
results.abstract: Americans love a candidate who promises something new. But when a sitting president runs against a former one, can either claim the mantle of change?
results.byline: By Adam Nagourney and Shane Goldmacher

multimedia.copyright: Tom Brenner for The New York Times
Tom Brenner for The New York Times

results.title: Biden Makes a Rare Mention of Marijuana in the State of the Union
results.abstract: The president pointed toward his efforts to ease restrictions on cannabis, a potential signal that he could talk more during the campaign about an issue he has been reluctant to embrace.

results.title: Senate Clears $460 Billion Bill to Avert Partial Shutdown, Sending It to Biden
results.abstract: The White House said the executive branch was halting shutdown preparations and that President Biden would sign the bill on Saturday. But the spending fight isn’t over yet.

multimedia.caption: “To folks who worry that divided government means nothing ever gets done, this bipartisan package says otherwise,” said Senator Chuck Schumer, the majority leader, shown with Representative Hakeem Jeffries, the House Democratic leader.

results.title: Ratings Jump 18% for Biden’s Feisty State of the Union

results.title: Republicans’ Big F.B.I. Cut Came From Scrapping One Senator’s Earmark
results.abstract: The G.O.P. has boasted about cutting the budget of what it calls the “weaponized” F.B.I. by 6 percent. Most of that came from wiping out the pet project of retired Senator Richard C. Shelby.

results.title: No Labels, a Centrist Group, Moves Toward a Third-Party Presidential Bid
results.abstract: The group said it had voted to nominate a ticket, but did not announce which candidate might run on its ballot line. Democrats have worried that such a bid could siphon support from President Biden.
